problem_text: Let R and S be associative rings with identity such that 2 is invertible in S. Let ΛI : GLn(R) → GLn(R/I) be the homomorphism corresponding to an ideal I of R and let En(R) be the subgroup of GLn(R) generated by elementary transvections tij(x). Let aij = tij(1)tji(−1)tij(1), let the bar denote images in the factor-group of GLn(R) by the centre and let PG = G for G ⩽ GLn(R). A homomorphism Λ: En(R) → GL(W) = GLm(S) is called standard if Sm = P ⊕ · · · ⊕ P ⊕ Q (a direct sum of S-modules in which there are n summands P) and Λx = g−1τ(δ∗(x)f + (tδ∗(x)ν)−1(1 − f))g, x ∈ En(R), where δ∗: GLn(R) → GLn(End P) is the homomorphism induced by a ring homomorphism δ : R → End P taking identity to identity, g is an isomorphism of the module W onto Sm, τ : GLn(End P) → GL(gW) is an embedding, f is a central idempotent of δR, t denotes transposition and ν is an antiisomorphism of δR. Let n ⩾ 3, m ⩾ 2. One can show that the homomorphism Λ0 : PEn(R) → GL(W) = GLm(S) is induced by a standard homomorphism Λ if Λ0aij = g−1τ(a∗ij)g for some g and τ and for any i ≠ j where a∗ij denotes the matrix obtained from aij by replacing 0 and 1 from R by 0 and 1 from End P. Find (at least in particular cases) the form of a homomorphism Λ0 that does not satisfy the last condition. V. M. Petechuk
